intro: Phalocallis pusilla, commonly known as the small phalocallis, is a delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its miniature size and intricate floral structure. The plant produces tiny, fragrant flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, Phalocallis pusilla is considered a conservation concern in its native range.
